required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fabry Disease Screening in ESRD Patients in West of France
clinical_study.official_title: Fabry Disease Prevalence in End-stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Patients on Dialysis or Transplant in West of France

brief_summary.textblock: Screening of Fabry disease in end-stage renal disease (ESRD) patients on dialysis or transplant in west of France.

detailed_description.textblock: Detection of Fabry disease is done by dried blood spot test, in dialyzed and transplanted men, who reached ESRD for vascular or unknown disease and were not previously screened.

primary_outcome.measure: To detect Fabry disease by dried blood spot test, in dialyzed and transplanted men, who reached ESRD for vascular or unknown disease and were not previously screened

arm_group.arm_group_label: Men with ESRD on dialysis or transplant

intervention.arm_group_label: Men with ESRD on dialysis or transplant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men less than 70 years old
- ESRD treated by dialysis or kidney graft in one of the 4 following regions : Bretagne, Centre, Pays de la Loire and Poitou-Charentes
- For unknown nephropathy OR vascular nephropathy and/or diabetic nephropathy unproved by biopsy
- Agreeing freely to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men less than 18 years old
- Persons subject to major legal protection (safeguarding justice, guardianship, trusteeship), persons deprived of liberty.
